contentList.content: You have honed your body and magic for war. After you cast a <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrip</LSTag>, you can make a weapon attack using a bonus action, or vice versa.

Your next weapon attack costs a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> instead of an <LSTag Tooltip="Action">action</LSTag>. This attack can lead up to any <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="ExtraAttack">Extra Attack(s)</LSTag> you may have.
Your next <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrip</LSTag> costs a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> instead of an <LSTag Tooltip="Action">action</LSTag>.
You have used your War Magic for this turn.
Your unarmed attacks deal [1]. If you are not holding anything in your off hand, you can make an unarmed attack as a bonus action.
Your unarmed attacks deal [1], the same as your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SuperiorityDie">Superiority Die</LSTag>.
You deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> with unarmed strikes.
For unarmed attacks, the number you need to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">roll</LSTag> a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> is reduced by an additional 1. This effect can stack.
While unarmed, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="WM_BONUS_CANTRIP">War Magic</LSTag> cantrip spell attacks will be affected by your unarmed damage bonuses.

Bound weapons use the wielder's <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Ability Modifier</LSTag> instead of <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, if it's higher.
